content:
• Thursday, May 10, 2012
  • DB

    Deutsche Bank agrees to pay $202M to settle a case brought by the U.S. last spring that charged...

    Deutsche Bank agrees to pay $202M to settle a case brought by the U.S. last spring that charged the bank with recklessly lying about mortgage loan quality to keep access to federal financing. A fourth notch for the U.S. under the False Claims Act; DB -2.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:28 PM | 1 Comment

    Assured Guaranty (NYSE:AGO): Q1 EPS of $0.38 beats by $0.02. Shares -1.4% AH. (PR)

    Assured Guaranty (NYSE:AGO): Q1 EPS of $0.38 beats by $0.02. Shares -1.4% AH. (PR)

    Arena Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ARNA) resumes trading, shares are currently +89% AH.

    Arena Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ARNA) resumes trading, shares are currently +89% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:03 PM | 7 Comments
  • JWN

    More on Nordstrom (NYSE:JWN): Q1 EPS misses despite higher revenues and a jump in same-store...

    More on Nordstrom (NYSE:JWN): Q1 EPS misses despite higher revenues and a jump in same-store sales, as margins were pressured by lower-priced offerings. The company reaffirmed its full-year earnings guidance. Shares -5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:00 PM
  • MDR

    More on McDermott (NYSE:MDR): Q1 misses on revenue but beats on a per share basis. Net profit...

    More on McDermott (NYSE:MDR): Q1 misses on revenue but beats on a per share basis. Net profit slid 11% Y/Y due to lower fabrication man hours and weaker marine activity in its Asia Pacific operations, though cost controls helped to boost overall bottom line performance. Shares +9.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM

    Procera Networks (NYSEMKT:PKT): Q1 EPS of $0.13 beats by $0.10. Revenue of $12.3M (+78.3% Y/Y)...

    Procera Networks (NYSEMKT:PKT): Q1 EPS of $0.13 beats by $0.10. Revenue of $12.3M (+78.3% Y/Y) beats by $0.4M. Shares +10.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:01 PM

    Career Education (NASDAQ:CECO): Q1 EPS of $0.60 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.24....

    Career Education (NASDAQ:CECO): Q1 EPS of $0.60 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.24. Revenue of $434.1M (-18.4% Y/Y) beats by $5M. Shares +7.1% AH. (PR)

    Greenway Medical Technologies (NYSE:GWAY): FQ3 EPS of $0.08 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $32.9M (+52.1% Y/Y) beats by $4.5M. Shares +8.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:51 PM

    Other drug stocks are reacting to the FDA decision on Arena Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ARNA)...

    Other drug stocks are reacting to the FDA decision on Arena Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ARNA) Locaserin: OREX +10%, VVUS +2.3%

    Codexis (NASDAQ:CDXS): Q1 EPS of -$0.21 misses by $0.06. Revenue of $31.1M (flat Y/Y) beats by...

    Codexis (NASDAQ:CDXS): Q1 EPS of -$0.21 misses by $0.06. Revenue of $31.1M (flat Y/Y) beats by $0.3M. Shares -4.7% AH. (PR)

    Darling International (NYSE:DAR): Q1 EPS of $0.24 misses by $0.06. Revenue of $387M (+% Y/Y) misses by $23M. Shares -11.5% AH. (PR)

    Roundy's (NYSE:RNDY): Q1 EPS of $0.28 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $938.2M (+2.4% Y/Y) in-line....

    Roundy's (NYSE:RNDY): Q1 EPS of $0.28 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $938.2M (+2.4% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -6.9% AH. (PR)

    HiSoft Technology (HSFT): Q1 EPS of $0.27 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $65.5M (+47.9% Y/Y)...

    HiSoft Technology (HSFT): Q1 EPS of $0.27 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $65.5M (+47.9% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +4.7% AH. (PR)

    Amtech Systems (NASDAQ:ASYS): FQ2 EPS of -$0.54 may not be comparable to consensus of $-0.23....

    Amtech Systems (NASDAQ:ASYS): FQ2 EPS of -$0.54 may not be comparable to consensus of $-0.23. Revenue of $21.6M (-65% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -7.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • MBI

    MBIA (NYSE:MBI): Q1 EPS of $0.05 misses by $0.13. Revenue of $137M beats by $33M. Shares -4.3%...

    MBIA (NYSE:MBI): Q1 EPS of $0.05 misses by $0.13. Revenue of $137M beats by $33M. Shares -4.3% AH. (PR)

    McDermott International (NYSE:MDR): Q1 EPS of $0.25 beats by $0.10. Revenue of $727.7M (-19%...

    McDermott International (NYSE:MDR): Q1 EPS of $0.25 beats by $0.10. Revenue of $727.7M (-19% Y/Y) misses by $107M. Shares +8.8% AH. (PR)

  • JWN

    Nordstrom (NYSE:JWN): Q1 EPS of $0.70 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $2.53B (+% Y/Y) in-line....

    Nordstrom (NYSE:JWN): Q1 EPS of $0.70 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $2.53B (+% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -5.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • ECPG

    Debt collector Encore Capital Group (ECPG +5.9%) acquires Propel Financial Services a company...

    Debt collector Encore Capital Group (ECPG +5.9%) acquires Propel Financial Services a company that buys outstanding property tax obligations from municipalities, for ~$187M in a deal expected to boost earnings this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • CHK

    Chesapeake Energy (NYSE:CHK) is saddled with $1.4B of previously unreported liabilities due over...

    Chesapeake Energy (NYSE:CHK) is saddled with $1.4B of previously unreported liabilities due over coming years from off-balance sheet deals, WSJ reports. The company has commitments to banks requiring delivery of specific amounts of oil and gas. These so-called VPPs are essentially debts, with payments due in fuel rather than cash. Shares take a tumble, -1.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM | 58 Comments
  • DISH

    Dish Network's (DISH +1.5%) new feature allowing its satellite TV subscribers to skip all...

    Dish Network's (DISH +1.5%) new feature allowing its satellite TV subscribers to skip all commercials for prime time shows from the four major broadcast networks won't exactly win friends in the industry, Bernstein's Craig Moffett says. How can Dish maintain good relationships with its programming affiliates when it starts offering a feature intended to cut out most of those affiliates’ revenues?

     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM | 3 Comments
  • CTIC

    Cell Therapeutics (CTIC +9.9%) shares spike after the company reports its Pixuvri cancer drug is...

    Cell Therapeutics (CTIC +9.9%) shares spike after the company reports its Pixuvri cancer drug is approved in the EU as monotherapy to treat adults with multiply relapsed or refractory aggressive non-Hodgkin B-cell lymphomas. Pixuvri is the first approved treatment in the EU in this patient setting.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM | 5 Comments
  • PLCM

    Cisco's weak quarter with no Y/Y growth in its video conferencing segment does not bode well for...

    Cisco's weak quarter with no Y/Y growth in its video conferencing segment does not bode well for rival Polycom (PLCM -3.2%), Raymond James says, rating PLCM a Sell. The industry has declined rapidly from the 20%-30% Y/Y as recently as H1 2011, the firm says; difficulties are due to rapidly changing industry growth trends rather than market share losses.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM
  • MNST

    Monster Beverage's (MNST +9.1%) run back to over $74 a share makes Canaccord Genuity's Scott Van...

    Monster Beverage's (MNST +9.1%) run back to over $74 a share makes Canaccord Genuity's Scott Van Winkle skittish, as he tells clients in a research note that he can't recommend adding to or initiating a position due to the lofty valuation. Though the company's strong Q1 showed that the growth thesis is very much alive and cash flow is strong, a price-earnings ratio of 35 outpaces sector peers Dr. Pepper Snapple, Coca-Cola, and PepsiCo by a wide margin.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 PM | 3 Comments
  • BKNG

    With Priceline (PCLN -4.4%) reporting mixed Q1 results, analysts think there's still room to...

    With Priceline (PCLN -4.4%) reporting mixed Q1 results, analysts think there's still room to negotiate a higher stock price. BofA sees "potential for 50%+ ex-FX bookings growth in 2Q... and bookings upside in 3Q (vs. our 37% ex-FX est.) on easier [Y/Y] comps." Morgan Stanley says the outlook for international bookings should alleviate some of the worries about Europe.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM | 3 Comments
  • LYV

    Live Nation (LYV +10.2%) jumps after posting a better-than-expected Q1. Net losses loss widened...

    Live Nation (LYV +10.2%) jumps after posting a better-than-expected Q1. Net losses loss widened as a tax benefit lifted skewed the live-event promoter's year-ago results, masking an improvement in overall revenue in the latest period.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM
  • MYL

    Mylan (MYL +1.9%) gets a bump higher after the generic-drug maker raised its FY12 earnings...

    Mylan (MYL +1.9%) gets a bump higher after the generic-drug maker raised its FY12 earnings outlook earlier today. It now expects to earn between $2.45 - $2.55 per share. Street consensus is for an EPS of $2.42. The company also outlined plans to repurchase up to $500M in stock in a bid to increase shareholder value.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:24 PM
  • BPR

    General Growth Properties (GGP +1.6%) is upgraded to Buy from Neutral at UBS, with a $20 target...

    General Growth Properties (GGP +1.6%) is upgraded to Buy from Neutral at UBS, with a $20 target price up from $17, following solid Q1 results. After the Rouse spinoff and through continued dispositions of non-core assets, the firm thinks GGP is "successfully transforming into one of the leading Class A mall REITs," expecting the perception to be reflected in the valuation over time.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM
  • SUNEQ

    There's more downside ahead for MEMC Electronic (WFR -24%) after its latest quarterly miss,...

    There's more downside ahead for MEMC Electronic (WFR -24%) after its latest quarterly miss, Wunderlich says: "We have serious reservations about the future of MEMC given that there is still a tremendous oversupply of polysilicon worldwide, its vertically integrated solar business has no barriers to entry, and the solar gold rush is over as subsidies and stimulus run out."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM | 5 Comments
  • NXGN

    Healthcare information technology company Quality Systems (QSII -4.4%) slides after warning...

    Healthcare information technology company Quality Systems (QSII -4.4%) slides after warning earlier today that its FQ4 results will miss estimates. CEO Steven Plochocki blames delays associated with both the closing of several "opportunities" and revenue recognition on a large project.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM
  • SGMS

    Scientific Games (SGMS +12%) pops after posting a mixed Q1, missing on its EPS but beating on...

    Scientific Games (SGMS +12%) pops after posting a mixed Q1, missing on its EPS but beating on total revenue. Net earnings swung to a as the instant-ticket company reported stronger sales from all its major segments, led by an 81% Y/Y surge in revenue from its gaming business. Separately, Brean Murray ups the stock to buy on valuation, citing the strong Q1 report.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM
  • VRTU

    Virtusa (VRTU +14.2%) surges on an upgrade to Buy at BB&T Capital markets on the back of its...

    Virtusa (VRTU +14.2%) surges on an upgrade to Buy at BB&T Capital markets on the back of its in-line FQ4 results. The firm says it sees stable-to-improving demand trends in the company's financial services business, and activity is beginning to pick up.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM
  • BTE

    Baytex Energy (BTE -4.5%) shares slide after the Canadian oil and gas producer reports Q1 profit...

    Baytex Energy (BTE -4.5%) shares slide after the Canadian oil and gas producer reports Q1 profit jumped on higher production and strong oil prices but results fall short of estimates. Production averaged 53,433 boe/day, up 14% Y/Y. CEO Anthony Marino resigns and Executive Chairman Raymond Chan will take over as interim CEO.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM | 1 Comment
  • BCOR

    Shares of InfoSpace (INSP +26%) soar on heavy volume after blowing out Q1 estimates earlier this...

    Shares of InfoSpace (INSP +26%) soar on heavy volume after blowing out Q1 estimates earlier this morning. Net profit surged on a 124% leap in total revenue Y/Y, as the Internet search company's newly acquired TaxACT tax preparation business added substantially to its top line results. INSP bought the web-based TaxACT business for around $288M in cash just before tax season, and the acquisition has already added $40M to the company's revenue coffers in just its first quarter.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM
  • RAVE

    Shares of Pizza Inn (PZZI -16.2%) sink on heavier--than-normal volume after the company reports...

    Shares of Pizza Inn (PZZI -16.2%) sink on heavier--than-normal volume after the company reports narrower profits than last year with same-store sales that declined 1.4% Y/Y.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM
  • HTM

    U.S. Geothermal (HTM +10.2%) begins performance testing on its new San Emidio power plant....

    U.S. Geothermal (HTM +10.2%) begins performance testing on its new San Emidio power plant. During testing, all power generated will be sold at $50/megawatt-hour; upon acceptance of commercial operation by NV Energy (NYSE:NVE), the power rate will increase to $89.75/megawatt-hour with a 1% annual escalation.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM
  • CPNO

    Copano Energy (CPNO -13%) shares swoon after posting Q1 earnings and revenues that badly missed...

    Copano Energy (CPNO -13%) shares swoon after posting Q1 earnings and revenues that badly missed analyst estimates. Separately, CPNO plans to add an additional 400,000 Mcf/day to the cryogenic processing capacity at its Houston Central complex in response to continuing producer demand in the Eagle Ford Shale play.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM
  • ADNC

    Audience (NASDAQ:ADNC) and WageWorks (NYSE:WAGE)  soar 13.5% and 13.8% respectively on...

    Audience (NASDAQ:ADNC) and WageWorks (NYSE:WAGE)  soar 13.5% and 13.8% respectively on their trading debuts. Audience, which designs mobile phone chips, sold 5.27M shares at $17 each, above its range of $14-$16. WageWorks, an employee-benefit administrator, offered 6.5M shares at $9 a pop, below its target of $10-$12.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM
  • OLED

    Universal Display (PANL -10.6%) sinks after missing Q1 estimates, and analysts are profoundly...

    Universal Display (PANL -10.6%) sinks after missing Q1 estimates, and analysts are profoundly split in their opinions. Reiterating its Buy rating, Goldman sees "little risk" to 2012 revenues, with the take from Samsung lower than expected but better than the bear case. But Piper Jaffray reiterates an Underperform rating, with uncertainty in green emitter sales a risk to expectations.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM | 1 Comment
  • CRM

    Salesforce.com (CRM -9.4%) has been getting hammered since coming out of the gate this morning...

    Salesforce.com (CRM -9.4%) has been getting hammered since coming out of the gate this morning on cautious comments out of Macquarie and William Blair ahead of its quarterly results. William Blair says the company's U.S. enterprise business is coming in below plan, while Macquarie notes a possible slowdown in activity in its SDFC business.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM | 5 Comments
  • DGIT

    Digital Generation (DGIT -12.6%) trades lower despite Q1 results that slightly beat analysts'...

    Digital Generation (DGIT -12.6%) trades lower despite Q1 results that slightly beat analysts' estimates. Revenue was up 46% Y/Y, driven by higher HD growth in its TV segment. However, Janney Capital notes HD pricing declines are worsening - down about 40% due to its internet segment being disrupted by integration and client migration issues.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM
  • REPYY

    Repsol (OTCQX:REPYY +7.4%) moves to show it has a solid future without its nationalized...

    Repsol (OTCQX:REPYY +7.4%) moves to show it has a solid future without its nationalized Argentine unit, publishing Q1 earnings figures showing a net profit increase both with and without YPF. Net Q1 profit including YPF rose 3.5% Y/Y to $1.02B; adjusted to exclude the Argentine unit, net profit would have climbed 12.4%. Either way, "a solid set of results," an RBC analyst says.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM
  • AMAG

    AMAG Pharmaceuticals (AMAG -12.9%) says it's hired William K. Heiden as its new president and...

    AMAG Pharmaceuticals (AMAG -12.9%) says it's hired William K. Heiden as its new president and CEO, and plays down talk of a sale of the company. Baird cuts the shares to neutral on the news, saying that while a take-out was by no means its sole investment thesis, AMAG's new direction - switching roles from seller to buyer - introduces new a element of risk into its model.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM
  • M

    Nomura maintains its Buy/Top Pick tag on Macy's (M -1.1%) after digesting the company's Q1...

    Nomura maintains its Buy/Top Pick tag on Macy's (M -1.1%) after digesting the company's Q1 report. While the Street takes Macy's lack of improved guidance as a worrying factor, analyst Paul Lejuez says management is just being cautious and revenue trend are still strong.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM
  • AEG

    Aegon (AEG +10.2%) soar after reporting a surprise increase in Q1 net profit, helped by...

    Aegon (AEG +10.2%) soar after reporting a surprise increase in Q1 net profit, helped by investment gains and lower impairments. The Dutch insurer and pensions company says it will continue focusing on bolstering its capital buffer to shield itself from economic uncertainties.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM
  • ADY

    Shares of Feihe International (ADY +23.1%) ride the company's profit beat higher as they cruise...

    Shares of Feihe International (ADY +23.1%) ride the company's profit beat higher as they cruise to 9-month highs. The firm saw margins expand as it increased its focus on premium branded infant formula products.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • MGA

    Magna International (MGA +4.4%) shoots up after reporting Q1 results that came in well-ahead of...

    Magna International (MGA +4.4%) shoots up after reporting Q1 results that came in well-ahead of estimates and raising its view for total sales for 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • SUNEQ

    MEMC Electronic (WFR -12.3%) shares near a 10-year low following Q1 results that showed...

    MEMC Electronic (WFR -12.3%) shares near a 10-year low following Q1 results that showed widening losses on weaker revenue in both major segments due to softer pricing and volumes. WFR says its semi wafer business appears to have bottomed in Q1 and margins should return to positive by H2, but falling solar prices likely will extend losses well into 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • QNST

    Shares of QuinStreet (QNST +2.2%) perk up after FMR discloses in a SEC filing that it recently...

    Shares of QuinStreet (QNST +2.2%) perk up after FMR discloses in a SEC filing that it recently picked up a 15% stake in the online marketing company. YTD shares of QNST have slumped 12.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM
  • ARMH

    ARM (ARMH +3.2%) gets a boost from Bernstein's Pierre Ferragu, who raises his rating on the...

    ARM (ARMH +3.2%) gets a boost from Bernstein's Pierre Ferragu, who raises his rating on the stock to Market Perform and asserts it is now fairly valued. Ferragu thinks ARM eventually can become a “credible alternative” to Intel (NASDAQ:INTC) at the low-end PC and niche server markets, but is concerned about Intel's threat to ARM’s dominance in mobile phones and tablets.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM | 2 Comments
  • WIN

    Windstream (NASDAQ:WIN) -13.6% and the worst performer in the S&P 500 following its Q1 EPS...

    Windstream (NASDAQ:WIN) -13.6% and the worst performer in the S&P 500 following its Q1 EPS miss. Costs rising 77% to $1.29B and declines in overall consumer service and wholesale revenues may not be helping either. Still, net profit more than doubled to $64.6M, boosted by the acquisition of PAETEC Holding.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM | 9 Comments
  • NWS

    News Corp. (NWS, NWSA) trades 3.2% higher after its FQ3 report showed that strong results for...

    News Corp. (NWS, NWSA) trades 3.2% higher after its FQ3 report showed that strong results for its cable TV division were able to overcome the headline-grabbing scandal in the U.K. The company says it will extend an existing stock buyback by $5B, with the goal for it to be completed by the end of FY13.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:53 AM
  • AONEQ

    Shares of A123 Systems (AONE) roar out of the gate with a 2.7% gain - inspired in a large part...

    Shares of A123 Systems (AONE) roar out of the gate with a 2.7% gain - inspired in a large part by rosy FY12 guidance from Tesla Motors. SA author Alex Shadunsky picks the stock as one his top green stocks - as the company positions itself as a market leader for next-generation energy storage solutions.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:43 AM | 4 Comments
  • CDTI

    Clean Diesel Technologies (OTC:CDTI): Q1 EPS of -$0.39 misses by $0.10. Revenue of $17M (+23%...

    Clean Diesel Technologies (OTC:CDTI): Q1 EPS of -$0.39 misses by $0.10. Revenue of $17M (+23% Y/Y) in-line. Gross margin and results from operations were hurt by a product mix shift in London, which also resulted in a write-down of excess inventories of certain components. Shares -14.4% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:17 AM

  • Market preview: U.S. stock futures follow much of Europe higher on Spain's moves to alleviate...

    Market preview: U.S. stock futures follow much of Europe higher on Spain's moves to alleviate its banking crisis and speculation that Greece might actually form a government against all expectations. The S&P benchmark is +0.7%, while the Dow is +0.4 and looking set to break its six-day losing streak. That's despite Cisco falling 7.9% following its downbeat outlook. Later: Bernanke and Kocherlakota
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • PAA

    Plains All American (NYSE:PAA) is upgraded to Conviction Buy at Goldman Sachs with an increased...

    Plains All American (NYSE:PAA) is upgraded to Conviction Buy at Goldman Sachs with an increased price target of $100 from $93. PAA has leverage to several key midstream themes, the firm says, including oil infrastructure growth, continued crude oil price volatility and wide basis differentials which drive higher logistics margins, and a strong financial profile. PAA +1.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:08 AM
  • AMCX

    Shares of AMC Networks (NASDAQ:AMCX) shoot up 1.8% premarket after the company beat the...

    Shares of AMC Networks (NASDAQ:AMCX) shoot up 1.8% premarket after the company beat the estimates of analysts with its earnings report. The company's quarter received a big boost from the soaring ratings for The Walking Dead and the advertising revenue the show kicked up.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:06 AM
  • RPRX

    Premarket gainers: RPRX +17%. KERX +13%. MNST +12%. AEG +10%. NBG +9%. TSLA +8%. YONG +8%....

    Premarket gainers: RPRX +17%. KERX +13%. MNST +12%. AEG +10%. NBG +9%. TSLA +8%. YONG +8%.
    Losers: OTC:CDTI -14%. SGI -14%. PANL -13%. QSII -10%. CSCO -8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:06 AM
  • KERX

    Keryx Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:KERX) +12.4% premarket, enjoying a boost from two analyst buy...

    Keryx Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:KERX) +12.4% premarket, enjoying a boost from two analyst buy recommendations. Ladenburg Thalmann notes data from the long-term Phase 3 study of hyposphatemia drug Zerenex (data expected in Q4) represents a "significant event" for KERX. Roth Capital raises its target price on the shares to $7 from $4.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:54 AM
  • ULTA

    An offering of 7M shares of Ulta Salon (NASDAQ:ULTA) prices at $84 a share - marking only a...

    An offering of 7M shares of Ulta Salon (NASDAQ:ULTA) prices at $84 a share - marking only a slight discount to yesterday's closing price. Shares of ULTA +1.4% premarket on the strong demand for the block offered up by entities associated with Mousse Partners.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:52 AM
  • KSS

    More on Kohl's (NYSE:KSS) Q1: Comparable-store sales +0.2%. Says it accelerated new receipts...

    More on Kohl's (NYSE:KSS) Q1: Comparable-store sales +0.2%. Says it accelerated new receipts into Q2 to prepare inventory for the Back-to-School season. Gross margin slipped to 35.9%, from 38.1%. Opened 9 new stores, plans to open 10 more stores in fall season. Declares $0.32/share dividend. Sees EPS of $0.96-$1.02 in Q2. Shares -1.5% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:25 AM
